Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks if the database is up and running. It does this by making a request to the database, which will raise an exception if it’s not working.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.read_root()¶

The read_root function returns a dictionary with the key &quot;message&quot; and value &quot;Hello World !&quot;.

Returns:

A dictionary with a &quot;message&quot; key

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are needed by your app, like connecting to databases or initializing caches.

Returns:

A coroutine, which is a function that returns a future

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(contact: ContactCreate, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.
Args:

contact (schemas.contact.ContactCreate): The ContactCreate schema object that contains all of the information for creating a new contact in the database, including name, phone number and email address. db (AsyncSession): The SQLAlchemy AsyncSession object used to connect to and query our PostgreSQL database using SQLAlchemy’s ORM syntax instead of raw SQL queries. This is passed into this function by dependency injection from FastAPI’s Dependency Injection system which allows us to access it without having to import it directly into this file

Parameters:

  • contact – schemas.contact.ContactCreate: Pass the contact data to the function

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the user object

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_all_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, user: User, session: AsyncSession) → List[Contact]¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n contacts

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, session: AsyncSession, user: User) → Contact | None¶

The get_contact function returns a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id to be retrieved

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

  • user – User: Get the user id from the user object

Returns:

A contact object or none

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_upcoming_birthdays(db: AsyncSession, user: User) → List[Contact]¶

The get_upcoming_birthdays function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthday is within the next week

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User) → Contact | None¶

The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

  • user – User: Get the user’s id

Returns:

The contact that was removed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(db: AsyncSession, query: str, user: User) → List[Contact]¶

The search_contacts function searches the database for contacts that match a given query. The function takes in two arguments:

  • db: The database session to use when querying the database.

  • query: The string to search for in the first_name, last_name, and email fields of all contacts.

The function returns a list of Contact objects that match the given query.

Parameters:

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • query – str: Search for contacts by first name, last name or email

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactBase, db: AsyncSession, user: User) → Contact | None¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be updated

  • body – ContactBase: Pass the contact body to the function

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is authorized to update the contact

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user to be confirmed

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession)¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Create a database session

Returns:

A new user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user we want to retrieve

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database connection

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

The update_avatar_url function updates the avatar url of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Find the user in the database

  • url – str | None: Specify that the url parameter can be either a string or none

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user object from the database

  • token – str | None: Specify the type of the token parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. Then, it checks if that user exists in our database, and if they do not exist, we log an error message and return a 400 Bad Request response with an appropriate detail message.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the email from the token

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A message if the email is already confirmed or confirms it

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes the username and password from the request body, verifies that they are correct, and returns an access token.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get a database connection

Returns:

A token, but the refresh function does not

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Depends(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token. It takes in a refresh token and returns a new access_token, refresh_token pair. The function first decodes the refresh token to get the email of the user who owns it. It then gets that user from the database and checks if their stored refresh_token matches what was passed in. If not, it raises an error because this means that either:

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the credentials from the request header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with the access_token, refresh_token and token_type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that they can click on to confirm their email address. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already a confirmed user with that email address, and if so returns an error message saying as much. If not, it sends them an email containing a link they can click on.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A message to the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserSchema object as input, and returns the newly created user. If an account with that email already exists, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • bt – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactCreate, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

The function takes a ContactCreate object as input, which is validated against the schema defined in schemas/contact.py The function also requires an authenticated user to be passed into it via dependency injection (see auth_service)

Parameters:

  • body – schemas.contact.ContactCreate: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the repository function

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The new contact created

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_contact function is used to retrieve a single contact from the database. It takes in an integer representing the ID of the contact, and returns a Contact object.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id to be retrieved

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A single contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip a certain number of contacts, for example if you want to get the second page

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id of the contact to be removed

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

The contact that was removed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.search_contacts(query: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The search_contacts function searches for contacts in the database.

It takes a query string and returns a list of contacts that match the query.

Parameters:

  • query – str: Search for a contact

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the search query

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.upcoming_birthdays(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The upcoming_birthdays function returns a list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Parameters:

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

It takes an id of the contact to update, and a body containing the new data for that contact. The function returns an updated Contact object.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • body – ContactUpdate: Get the data from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.get_current_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

get_current_user endpoint. It takes an optional file and user parameter, which are both dependencies themselves. The file parameter is a File object, which represents an uploaded file from the client. The user parameter is a User object, which represents the current authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request body

  • user – User: Get the user from the token

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

:param : Get the current user :return: The user object :doc-author: Trelent

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = '1234567890'¶
cache = <redis.client.Redis(<redis.connection.ConnectionPool(<redis.connection.Connection(host=localhost,port=6379,db=0)>)>)>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional parameter specifying how long, in seconds,

the access token should last before expiring. If not specified, it defaults to 15 minutes.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded in the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time for the access token

Returns:

A string that is the encoded access token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is created using the JWT library, which uses the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM to create an encoded string. The data dictionary contains information about the user’s email address, as well as when it was issued (iat) and when it expires (exp). The iat and exp values are added to the data dict before encoding.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the user’s email,

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The time in seconds until the token expires. Defaults to None, which sets it to 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded into the refresh token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Specify the number of seconds until the token expires

Returns:

A refresh token that is encoded with the jwt algorithm

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It will raise an exception if the token is invalid or has expired. If it’s valid, it returns the email address of the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email address of the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user object if it exists, otherwise it raises an exception.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class variables

  • token – str: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – AsyncSession: Access the database

Returns:

The user object, which is a user class

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses PyJWT to decode the token, which is then used to retrieve the email address from its payload.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that was sent to the user’s email

Returns:

The email address of the user who is trying to verify their account

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Get the password from the user

Returns:

A hash of the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the method a bound method, which means that the first parameter will always be

  • plain_password – Check the password that was entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Check if the password provided by the user matches with the hashed password stored in database

Returns:

A boolean value

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to verify their email address.
The function takes in three parameters:
-email: the user’s email address, which is used as a recipient for the message and also as part of

the token that will be sent in order to verify their account. This parameter must be of type EmailStr, which is defined by pydantic and ensures that it is a valid email format. If not, then an error will occur.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the user

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to be used in the email

Returns:

A coroutine

Doc-author:

Trelent
